setters.set: A disciplined martial artist who focuses inner power into supernatural effects.

description.p: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at levels 4, 8, 12, and 16.
While you arenâ€™t wearing armor or wielding a Shield, you gain special benefits with Unarmed Strikes and Monk weapons.
Martial Arts Damage. Your Unarmed Strike damage uses a Martial Arts die, shown in the Monk Features table.
Dexterous Strikes. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes and Monk weapons.
Bonus Unarmed Strike. When you take the Attack action on your turn and attack with an Unarmed Strike or a Monk weapon, you can make one Unarmed Strike as a Bonus Action.

sheet.description: Your Unarmed Strike uses a Martial Arts die ({{martial arts:dice}}) and can use Dexterity for attack and damage. After the Attack action with an Unarmed Strike or a Monk weapon, make one Unarmed Strike as a Bonus Action.

description.p: While you arenâ€™t wearing armor or wielding a Shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

sheet.description: AC = 10 + DEX mod + WIS mod while not wearing armor or wielding a Shield.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you harness inner power through Focus Points that fuel certain Monk features.
Focus Points. You have a number of Focus Points equal to your Monk level. You regain all expended points when you finish a Short or Long Rest.
Focus Save DC. 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.
You can expend 1 Focus Point to make two Unarmed Strikes as a Bonus Action.
You can take the Disengage action as a Bonus Action. Alternatively, you can expend 1 Focus Point to take both the Disengage and the Dodge actions as a Bonus Action.
You can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action. Alternatively, you can expend 1 Focus Point to take both the Disengage and Dash actions as a Bonus Action; your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

sheet.description: You have {{monk:focus:points}} Focus Points; Focus DC {{monk:focus:dc}}. You gain the following features.

description.p: While you arenâ€™t wearing armor or wielding a Shield, your Speed increases by the amount shown in the Monk Features table.

When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended Focus Points. When you do so, roll your Martial Arts die and regain Hit Points equal to your Monk level plus the number rolled. Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

sheet.description: Restore all Focus Points and regain 1d{{martial arts:dice}}+{{level:monk}} HP.
Restore all Focus Points and regain 1d{{martial arts:dice}}+{{level:monk}} HP. If you don't use this feature, on initiative you regain expended Focus Points until you have 4 if you have 3 or fewer.

description.p: When an attack roll hits you and its damage includes Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage, you can use a Reaction to reduce the attackâ€™s total damage by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can expend 1 Focus Point to redirect some of the attackâ€™s force: choose a creature you can see within 5 feet of you (melee attack) or within 60 feet that isnâ€™t behind Total Cover (ranged attack). That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Focus DC, taking damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die + your Dexterity modifier on a failed save. The damage type matches the original attack.

sheet.description: Reduce incoming Bludgeoning,Piercing and Slashing damage by 1d10+{{deflect attacks:damage:bonus}}. If reduced to 0, expend 1 Focus Point to force a DEX save (DC {{monk:focus:dc}}) on a target (5 ft melee / 60 ft ranged); on a fail it takes 2d{{martial arts:dice}} + {{dexterity:modifier}} of the attackâ€™s damage type.

Reduce any type of incoming damage by 1d10+{{deflect attacks:damage:bonus}}. If reduced to 0, expend 1 Focus Point to force a DEX save (DC {{monk:focus:dc}}) on a target (5 ft melee / 60 ft ranged); on a fail it takes 2d{{martial arts:dice}} + {{dexterity:modifier}} of the attackâ€™s damage type.

description.p: You can use your Reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your Monk level.

sheet.description: Reduce falling damage by {{slow fall:damage:reduction}}.

description.p: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as part of that action.

sheet.description: You can make 2 attacks.

description.p: Whenever you deal damage with your Unarmed Strike, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

sheet.description: Your Unarmed Strikes can deal Force damage instead of their normal type.

description.p: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage on a success and only half damage on a failure.

sheet.description: When you roll a DEX save to halve a damage: on a success = no damage; on a failure = half damage.

description.p: While you arenâ€™t wearing armor or wielding a Shield, you can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the movement.

sheet.description: Move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn (no fall during the movement) while unarmored and without a Shield.

description.p: At the end of each of your turns, you can remove one of the following conditions from yourself: Charmed, Frightened, or Poisoned. In addition, forgoing food and drink doesnâ€™t give you levels of Exhaustion.

sheet.description: At the end of your turn: end Charmed, Frightened, or Poisoned on yourself. Forgoing food/drink doesnâ€™t cause Exhaustion.

description.p: You gain proficiency in all saving throws. Additionally, when you fail a saving throw, you can expend 1 Focus Point to reroll it; you must use the new roll.

sheet.description: On a failed Saving Throw, expend 1 Focus Point to reroll and use the new roll.

description.p: When you roll initiative and donâ€™t use Uncanny Metabolism, you regain expended Focus Points until you have 4 if you have 3 or fewer.

sheet.description: On initiative (if you donâ€™t use Uncanny Metabolism): restore Focus Points up to 4 if you had 3 or fewer.

description.p: At the start of your turn, you can expend 3 Focus Points to bolster yourself for 1 minute or until you are Incapacitated. During that time, you have Resistance to all damage except Force.

sheet.description: At the start of your turn: expend 3 Focus Points to gain Resistance to all damage except Force for 1 minute (ends if you become Incapacitated).

description.p: Your Dexterity and Wisdom scores each increase by 4, to a maximum of 25.
You can expend 1 Focus Point to make two Unarmed Strikes as a Bonus Action.

Expend 1 Focus Point to make three Unarmed Strikes

description.p: You can take the Disengage action as a Bonus Action. Alternatively, you can expend 1 Focus Point to take both the Disengage and the Dodge actions as a Bonus Action.

sheet.description: You take the Disengage Action. Expending 1 Focus Point, you take both Disengage and Dodge Action.
You gain 2d{{martial arts:dice}} Temporary Hit Points. You take the Disengage Action. Expending 1 Focus Point, you take both Disengage and Dodge Action.

description.p: You can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action. Alternatively, you can expend 1 Focus Point to take both the Disengage and Dash actions as a Bonus Action, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

sheet.description: You take the Dash Action. Expending 1 Focus Point, you take both Disengage and Dash Action, and your jump distance is doubled.

You take the Dash Action. Expending 1 Focus Point, you take both Disengage and Dash Action, and your jump distance is doubled. You can bring with you a Large or smaller willing creature within 5ft of you, without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

description.p: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a Monk weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can expend 1 Focus Point to force a Constitution saving throw (Focus DC). On a failed save, the target is Stunned until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the targetâ€™s Speed is halved until the start of your next turn, and the next attack roll against it before then has Advantage.

sheet.description: You can expend 1 Focus Point to force a target to make a CON save (DC {{monk:focus:dc}}). On a fail: Stunned until your next turn starts. On a success: speed halved and your next attack vs it has Advantage.
